ca.nejedly.mail.imap
Class GotMailVO

java.lang.Object
  ca.nejedly.mail.imap.GotMailVO
public class GotMailVO
extends java.lang.Object

Value Object holding the message counts and optionally also some email message information like the subject, date, from address,...

Author:
Zdenek Nejedly znejedly@uoguelph.ca
See Also:
GotMail

Field Detail

messages

protected java.util.Vector messages
Optional email messages. If this field is not null then it is used to determine the total message count or the unseen message count. If it is null then the countUnseen or countTotal fields are used directly.

See Also:
countUnseen, countTotal

countTotal

protected int countTotal
Total number of messages in the folder. Used if the messages structure is null.

countUnseen

protected int countUnseen
Number of unseen messages in the folder. Used if the messages structure is null.

normLenSubject

protected int normLenSubject
See Also:
messages

normLenFromAddress

protected int normLenFromAddress

getCountTotal

public int getCountTotal()

setCountTotal

public void setCountTotal(int countTotal)
Parameters:
countTotal - The total number of messages to set. Use this method if the messages structure is null.
See Also:
messages

getCountSeen

public int getCountSeen()
Returns:
Returns the number of seen messages. The internal messages structure is authoritative if non-null, i.e., if it is not a null then the countTotal and countUnseen fields are ignored.
See Also:
messages

setCountSeen

public void setCountSeen(int countSeen)
Parameters:
countSeen - Dummy setter - does nothing.

getCountUnseen

public int getCountUnseen()
Returns:
Returns the number of unseen messages. The internal messages structure is authoritative if non-null, i.e., if it is not a null then the countTotal and countUnseen fields are ignored.
See Also:
messages

public void setCountUnseen(int countUnseen)
Parameters:
countUnseen - The number of unseen messages to set. Use this method if the messages structure is null.
See Also:
messages

normalizeString

public static java.lang.String normalizeString(java.lang.String source,
                                               int maxLength)
If the provided string is longer then the specified maxLength - the length of the internally added suffix '...' then the method shortens the string to maxLength-len(suffix) and adds the suffix. Returns an unchanged string otherwise If the specified maxLength is 0 or <0 then no modifications are done

Parameters:
source -
maxLength -
Returns:
original string limited to the maxLength length
